subject: Math
title: Finding Maximum and Minimum Values
description: Use the vertex to find maximum and minimum values of quadratics

content.text: The vertex of a parabola gives us the maximum or minimum value of the function. This is incredibly useful in optimization problems!

content.heading: Maximum and Minimum
content.text:
• If a > 0: parabola opens upward → vertex is a minimum
• If a < 0: parabola opens downward → vertex is a maximum
• The y-coordinate of the vertex is the max/min value
• This occurs at x = -b/(2a)

content.heading: Example 1
content.problem: Find the minimum value of f(x) = x² - 6x + 11

content.heading: Example 2
content.problem: Find the maximum value of f(x) = -2x² + 8x - 3
